p:
Interestingly, no autochthonous human cases of DENV-3 have been reported in the city of São Paulo since 2010
23 (Supplementary Fig. S3). In fact, DENV-3 circulation was detected in the city of São Paulo in 2010
52 , but this serotype was not identified in this area during the epidemic of 2014
53 . This strengthens the hypothesis that vertical transmission could help maintain viral circulation during interepidemic periods and suggests that there is silent circulation of DENV-3 in green areas of São Paulo, a city with no detected autochthonous cases of infection by this serotype.
